newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy government said to be finalising mini-budget.
newsitem.headline: Italy government said to be finalising mini-budget.

text.p: The Italian government and coalition parties are putting the final touches to the 1997 mini-budget, said Romualdo Coviello, chairman of the budget commission of the upper house Senate.
The mini-budget, which will include up to 16 trillion lire of deficit-cutting measures, is due to be unveiled by the end of this week.

"We are polishing up the details," Coviello told reporters as he left Prime Minister Romano Prodi's office. "There are positive convergences within the coalition and we are now down to the finishing touches," he added.

Political sources said Prodi was currently chairing an inter-ministerial meeting on the budget with Treasury minister Carlo Azeglio Ciampi, Finance Minister Vincenzo Visco, Labour minister Tiziano Treu and state auditor Andrea Monorchio.
